questions.question: What is the publication year of the article titled 'Ferromagnetic alternating spin chains'?
Who are the authors of the article with the DOI 10.1021/ja00241a053?
questions.answer: Andrea Caneschi, Dante Gatteschi, Jean Laugier, Paul Rey

questions.question: What is the range of pages for the article discussing ferromagnetic alternating spin chains?
What is the electronic publication date of the article with the DOI 10.1021/ja00241a053?
What is the journal name where the article titled 'Ferromagnetic alternating spin chains' was published?
questions.answer: Journal of the American Chemical Society

questions.question: What supplementary material file is associated with the article DOI 10.1021/ja00241a053?
Based on the publication and electronic publication dates, how many years after its initial publication was the article made available electronically?
Considering the authors' last names, which author's surname comes first alphabetically?
If you wanted to access the supplementary material for the article, what website would you likely visit based on the provided information?
Given the range of pages, how many pages does the article span?
If someone wanted to republish information from the supplementary material, what system must they use to request permission?
What is the difference in months between the issue publication date and the electronic publication date?
Based on the document, which type of copyright permission is required to redistribute any Supporting Information?
questions.answer: Permission from the American Chemical Society

questions.question: The article titled 'Ferromagnetic alternating spin chains' was published in the Journal of the American Chemical Society.
The article with DOI 10.1021/ja00241a053 was first published electronically in 1987.
The supplementary material for the article is only available to those with a subscription to ACS Web Editions.
The article spans over 3 pages.
Users can freely reproduce and sell any Supporting Information from the ACS website without permission.
The RightsLink permission system is used for requesting permission to republish ACS material.
The article was published electronically before it was available in print.
